shared.description: The whole metadata with important columns as Cluster (matching all the data),Cell_type (the full name of the cell type),Age (the time point of the sample),Colour (a hex value to use as a colour for that cluster)
Colour palettes and cluster annotations used for heatmaps, and timeseries
shared.contents: R object containing colour palettes, and heatmap annotations

joint_cortex.description: Rda file containing datasets generated in data_prep.R, to be loaded at the beginning of app.R to optimize run-time speed and efficiency.
joint_cortex.contents: Several R objects: forebrain_data, TF_and_ext, TF_active, metadata, tf_df, cell_metadata_cortex,binary_activity data

joint_cortex.description: feather file containing average TF activity per joint cluster instead of per sample cluster in the forebrain.
joint_cortex.contents: a data frame with a joint cluster column and columns corresponding to TFs and their activity in each cluster.

joint_cortex.description: Cell-level information for forebrain data, including corresponding clusters and UMAP/tSNE/PCA coordinates, used to plot scatterplots
joint_cortex.contents: Data frame with columns, 'Cell' 'Sample' 'Sample_cluster', followed by columns for embedding coordinates.

joint_cortex.description: Joint_cluster-level information for forebrain data, including color palatte for each cluster, used to color scatter plots
joint_cortex.contents: Data frame with columns, 'Cluster_number' 'Color' 'Cell_type' 'Sample' etc., followed by summary info for each cluster.

joint_cortex.description: Rds file containing data specific for the first tab, where the table is generated from this data file and used for plotting the cytoscape network to see correlations of different tfs with different/same genes related, note that the tf contai
joint_cortex.contents: Rds data specific each transcription factor and its corresponding genes and activity data, weight, highconfAnnotation data, motifs.

joint_cortex.description: A feather file of tf activity with respect to each cluster that is used for reading by a certain column to optimize speed, used for plotting tab2 (clustering and heatmap)
joint_cortex.contents: A dataframe, the first column is cluster, subsequent columns correspond to active TF (TF_active) the values describe the NES(activity score of TF in each cluster),

joint_cortex.description: A feather file of tf activity with respect to each cell that is used for reading by a certain column to optimize speed, used for plotting tab2(clustering and heatmap)
joint_cortex.contents: A dataframe, the first column is cluster, subsequent columns correspond to active TF (TF_active) the values describe the NES(activity score of TF in each cluster),

joint_cortex.description: Rds file that is read as tibble containing all tf names with suffix(extended and weight) in the dataset of the second/third tab, note that the tfs are not the same as the first tab data. This vector contains fewer tf than the data in the first tab
joint_cortex.contents: A character vector(read as tibble later) containing all tf names with suffix(extended and weight) in the dataset of the second/third tab.

joint_cortex.description: Binary activity of every tf in each cell, used for plotting cortex timeseries, we also use the rownames to generate a dataframe that saves all the tf names
joint_cortex.contents: A giant matrix with columns of each cell and rows of tfs, with 1 or 0 denoting the presence of that tf in the cell.

joint_pons.description: Rda file containing datasets generated in data_prep.R, to be loaded at the beginning of app.R to optimize run-time speed and efficiency.
joint_pons.contents: Several R objects: pons_data, TF_and_ext, TF_active, metadata, tf_df, cell_metadata_pons,binary_activity data

joint_pons.description: feather file containing average TF activity per joint cluster instead of per sample cluster in the pons.
joint_pons.contents: a data frame with a joint cluster column and columns corresponding to TFs and their activity in each cluster.

joint_pons.description: Joint_cluster-level information for forebrain data, including color palatte for each cluster, used to color scatter plots
joint_pons.contents: Data frame with columns, 'Cluster_number' 'Color' 'Cell_type' 'Sample' etc., followed by summary info for each cluster.

joint_pons.description: Cell-level information for pons data, including corresponding clusters and UMAP/tSNE/PCA coordinates, used to plot scatterplots
joint_pons.contents: Data frame with columns, 'Cell' 'Sample' 'Sample_cluster', followed by columns for embedding coordinates.

joint_pons.description: Rds file containing data specific for the first tab, where the table is generated from this data file and used for plotting the cytoscape network to see correlations of different tfs with different/same genes related, note that the tf contai
joint_pons.contents: Rds data specific each transcription factor and its corresponding genes and activity data, weight, highconfAnnotation data, motifs.

joint_pons.description: A feather file of tf activity with respect to each cluster that is used for reading by a certain column to optimize speed, used for plotting tab2 (clustering and heatmap)
joint_pons.contents: A dataframe, the first column is cluster, subsequent columns correspond to active TF (TF_active) the values describe the NES(activity score of TF in each cluster),

joint_pons.description: A feather file of tf activity with respect to each cell that is used for reading by a certain column to optimize speed, used for plotting tab2(clustering and heatmap)
joint_pons.contents: A dataframe, the first column is cluster, subsequent columns correspond to active TF (TF_active) the values describe the NES(activity score of TF in each cluster),

joint_pons.description: Rds file that is read as tibble containing all tf names with suffix(extended and weight) in the dataset of the second/third tab, note that the tfs are not the same as the first tab data. This vector contains fewer tf than the data in the first tab
joint_pons.contents: A character vector(read as tibble later) containing all tf names with suffix(extended and weight) in the dataset of the second/third tab.

joint_pons.description: Binary activity of every tf in each cell, used for plotting pons timeseries, we also use the rownames to generate a dataframe that saves all the tf names
joint_pons.contents: A giant matrix with columns of each cell and rows of tfs, with 1 or 0 denoting the presence of that tf in the cell.

ct_e12.description: Per cell metadata for this timepoint with cluster assignments and embedding coordinates
ct_e12.contents: Dataframe with cell metadata. - Has multiple cluster assignments

ct_e12.description: Active TFs in this sample and their gene target information: number of motifs, GENIE3 weight, best motif, motif logo URL
Activity of each TF in each cell in this sample
ct_e12.contents: A feather file containing a data frame

ct_e12.description: Activity of each TF in each cluster in this sample
ct_e12.contents: A feather file containing a data frame

ct_e12.description: Colour palettes and cluster annotations used for heatmaps, GRN, info table, dr-plots
ct_e12.contents: R list object containing 3 tibbles and one vector; see details in data_prep.R
